pfm_subkeys.pfm_description: The human-readable description of this payload. This description appears on the Detail screen.
The human-readable name for the profile payload. The name appears on the Detail screen and doesn't need to be unique.

The reverse-DNS-style identifier for the payload. This identifier is usually the same as the TopLevel value, with an additional appended component. This string must be unique within the profile.
During a profile replacement, the system updates payloads with the same 'PayloadIdentifier' and 'PayloadUUID' in the old and new profiles.
The payload type, which each payload domain's reference page specifies.

The globally unique identifier for the payload. The actual content is unimportant, but must be globally unique. In macOS, use 'uuidgen' to generate UUIDs.
During a profile replacement, the system updates payloads with the same 'PayloadIdentifier' and 'PayloadUUID' in the old and new profiles.
The version of this specific payload.
The human-readable string containing the name of the organization that provides the profile. This value doesn't need to match the organization payload value in the enclosing dictionary.
Turns on "Use scroll gesture with modifier keys to zoom" in the zoom options
Turns on "Use keyboard shortcuts to zoom" in the zoom options
The maximal zoom magnification that can be set in the Zoom options in an integer value between 1 and 40
The minimal zoom magnification that can be set in the Zoom options in an integer value between 1 and 40
Turns on "Show preview rectangle" in the Zoom options
pfm_subkeys.pfm_title: Show preview rectangle when zoomed out

pfm_subkeys.pfm_description: Turns on "Smooth images" in the Zoom options
Turns on "Invert colors" in Display options
Turns on "Use grayscale" in the Display options
The contrast value in the Display options.
The size of the mouse cursor in a decimal value between 1 and 4, where 1 is normal and 4 is the maximum
VoiceOver provides spoken and brailled descriptions of items on the computer screen and provides control of the computer through the user of the keyboard
Turns on "Flash the screen when an alert sound occurs" in the Audio options
Turns on "Play stereo audio as mono" in the Audio options
Turns on "Sticky Keys" in the Keyboard options. Sticky keys allows modifier keys to be set without having to hold the key down
Turns on "Display pressed keys on screen" for Sticky Keys in Keyboard options
Turns on "Beep when a modifier key is set" for Sticky Keys in Keyboard options
pfm_subkeys.pfm_title: Beep when a modifier key is set

pfm_subkeys.pfm_description: Turns on "Slow Keys" in the Keyboard options. Slow keys adjusts the amount of time between when a key is pressed and when it is activated
Turns on "Use click key sounds" for Slow Keys in the Keyboard options
The acceptance delay for Slow Keys in miliseconds
Turns on "Enable Mouse Keys" in the Pointer Control options. Mouse Keys allows the mouse pointer to be controlled using the keyboard number pad
The initial delay before moving the mouse cursor with Mouse Keys in a decimal value representing seconds
The maximum speed for the cursor when using Mouse Keys in an integer value between 1 and 32, where 1 is the slowest and 32 is the fastest
Turns on "Ignore built-in trackpad when mouse or wireless trackpad is present" in the Mouse & Trackpad options
